give in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to finally agree to do or accept something that you had at first opposed, especially because someone has forced or persuaded you to
give in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Eventually I gave in and accepted the job on their terms.
Bob’s wife went on at him so much that eventually he gave in.
The government refused to give in to their demands.
give in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to accept that you are defeated in a game, fight, competition etc
give in.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The rebels were eventually forced to give in.
We will carry on fighting to the end. We will never give in.
give in.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to give a piece of work or something you have written to someone in authority
give in.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: You were supposed to give this work in four days ago.
Rose decided to give in her notice (=officially say she was going to leave her job).
All assignments must be given in to your teacher by Friday.
